
This test renames a receiver, type parameter, parameter or result var
whose name matches a package-level decl. This used to cause a spurious
shadowing error because of an edge case in the scope rules for
FuncType.

This is a regression test for issue #60752.

-- flags --
-min_go=go1.18

-- go.mod --
module example.com
go 1.18

-- a/type.go --
package a

type t int

-- a/recv.go --
package a

func (v t) _() {} //@ rename("v", t, recv)

-- a/param.go --
package a

func _(v t) {} //@ rename("v", t, param)

-- a/result.go --
package a

func _() (v t) { return } //@ rename("v", t, result)

-- a/typeparam.go --
package a

func _[v t]() {} //@ rename("v", t, typeparam)

-- b/b.go --
package b

import _ "example.com/a"

-- @recv/a/recv.go --
package a

func (t t) _() {} //@ rename("v", t, recv)

-- @param/a/param.go --
package a

func _(t t) {} //@ rename("v", t, param)

-- @result/a/result.go --
package a

func _() (t t) { return } //@ rename("v", t, result)

-- @typeparam/a/typeparam.go --
package a

func _[t t]() {} //@ rename("v", t, typeparam)
